top_stories.title: SignalWire Releases Open Source SDK for Voice AI
top_stories.description: SignalWire, the leader in Programmable Unified Communications (PUC), today announced the open beta of its fully open source Call Fabric SDK and Reference App. This milestone release empowers developers to quickly build, customize, and launch modern communications apps, including intelligent solutions powered by the SignalWire Voice AI Agent across web,... The post SignalWire Releases Open Source SDK for Voice AI first appeared on AI-Tech Park.
top_stories.author: Business Wire
top_stories.content: SignalWire, the leader in Programmable Unified Communications (PUC), today announced the open beta of its fully open source Call Fabric SDK and Reference App. This milestone release empowers developers to quickly build, customize, and launch modern communications apps, including intelligent solutions powered by the SignalWire Voice AI Agent across web,... The post SignalWire Releases Open Source SDK for Voice AI first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

top_stories.title: Observing and evaluating AI agentic workflows with Strands Agents SDK and Arize AX
top_stories.description: In this post, we present how the Arize AX service can trace and evaluate AI agent tasks initiated through Strands Agents, helping validate the correctness and trustworthiness of agentic workflows.
top_stories.author: Karan Singh
top_stories.content: In this post, we present how the Arize AX service can trace and evaluate AI agent tasks initiated through Strands Agents, helping validate the correctness and trustworthiness of agentic workflows.

top_stories.title: AI for the ancient world: how a new machine learning system can help make sense of Latin inscriptions
top_stories.description: A fragment of a bronze military diploma from Sardinia, issued by the emperor Trajan to a sailor on a warship, as restored by Aeneas. Assael et al. / Nature. CC-BY-NC-ND-4.0. top_stories.title: Gate-level emulation of an Intel 4004 in 4004 bytes of C
top_stories.description: A feature-complete gate-level microcoded Intel 4004 in 4004 bytes of C, capable of emulating the original Busicom calculator ROM for which the chip was originally designed.
top_stories.content: A feature-complete gate-level microcoded Intel 4004 in 4004 bytes of C, capable of emulating the original Busicom calculator ROM for which the chip was originally designed.

top_stories.title: How to reduce alert overload in defence SOCs
top_stories.description: If you’re a security leader or analyst within the defence space, you likely brace yourself for a daily battle with alert overload — and you’re not alone. Analysts face a relentless flood of notifications with the majority turning out to be false positives. Studies show that 71% of SOC personnel1 experience burnout and report feeling overwhelmed by alert volume. One of the top frustrations among analysts is that they’re spending too much time handling false positives and performing manual work....
top_stories.author: Crossley McEwen
